Measurement

class entity.base.measurement.Measurement(name: str, *, notes: Optional[str] = None, conditions: Optional[list[gemd.entity.attribute.condition.Condition]] = None, parameters: Optional[list[gemd.entity.attribute.parameter.Parameter]] = None, properties: Optional[list[gemd.entity.attribute.property.Property]] = None, material: Optional[MaterialRun] = None)

Bases: ProcessOrMeasurement

Base class for measurements.

property spec: MeasurementSpec

The underlying measurement spec.

property run: MeasurementRun

The underlying measurement run.

classmethod from_spec_or_run(name: str, *, notes: Optional[str] = None, spec: Optional[MeasurementSpec] = None, run: Optional[MeasurementRun] = None) → Measurement

Instantiate a Measurement from a spec or run with appropriate validation.

Note that the spec’s template will be set to the class template, and the run’s spec will be set to this spec.

get_material() → str

Get the name of the material on sstate the measurement run was performed.

material_name: str

set_material(material: Optional[MaterialRun]) → None

Set the material on sstate the measurement run was performed.

material: {MaterialRun, None}

The measurement’s material.

get_properties_dict() → dict[str, entity.base.typing.ValueAndOrigin]

Return a dict of measurement run properties.

The keys are the names of the properties. Each value is a dict containing a value dict and origin str.

Example output:

{
‘Measured intensity’: {

‘value’: {‘nominal’: 1234, ‘units’: ‘’, ‘type’: ‘nominal_real’}, ‘origin’: ‘measured’

}, ‘Background-subtracted intensity’: {

‘value’: {‘nominal’: 1000, ‘units’: ‘’, ‘type’: ‘nominal_real’}, ‘origin’: ‘computed’

},

}

update_properties(properties: Property, replace_all: bool = False) → None

Change or add measured properties of the measurement run.

*properties: Property

The properties to change (by name) or add.

replace_all: bool, default False

If True, remove any existing properties before adding new ones.

ValueError

If the name of a property is not supported.

remove_properties(*property_names: str) → None

Remove measured properties from the measurement run by name.

*property_names: str

The names of properties to remove.

ValueError

If the name of a property is not supported.
